VII.ii.1.B.8.a
.
Finality of an Election of DEA or Education Benefits Under the Fry Scholarship
An election to receive DEA or education benefits under the Fry Scholarship is final.  Once VA pays either of the education benefits to a child, VA may
not
pay disability or survivors benefits to or for the same child for any period subsequent to the effective date of the first payment of education benefits.
Exception
:  A child who is under the age of 18 or permanently incapable of self-support may be able to reelect disability or survivors benefits after electing education benefits if
the child has two Veteran-parents in the same parental line, and
both parents died prior to June 9, 1960.
References
:  For more information on the
finality of an election of DEA, see
38 CFR 21.3023(c)
, and
exception cited in this block, see
38 CFR 21.3023(b)
, and
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.D.1
.
